data.name: PackageIdArgumentName
data.value: PACKAGE_ID

data.name: PackageIdArgumentDescription
data.value: The NuGet Package Id of the tool to install.

data.name: SpecifyExactlyOnePackageId
data.value: Specify one tool Package Id to install.

data.name: VersionOptionName
data.value: VERSION

data.name: VersionOptionDescription
data.value: The version of the tool package to install.

data.name: AddSourceOptionName
data.value: SOURCE

data.name: AddSourceOptionDescription
data.value: Add an additional NuGet package source to use during installation.

data.name: CommandDescription
data.value: Install global or local tool. Local tools are added to manifest and restored.

data.name: ConfigFileOptionName
data.value: FILE

data.name: ConfigFileOptionDescription
data.value: The NuGet configuration file to use.

data.name: FrameworkOptionName
data.value: FRAMEWORK

data.name: FrameworkOptionDescription
data.value: The target framework to install the tool for.

data.name: NuGetConfigurationFileDoesNotExist
data.value: NuGet configuration file '{0}' does not exist.

data.name: InstallationSucceeded
data.value: You can invoke the tool using the following command: {0} Tool '{1}' (version '{2}') was successfully installed.

data.name: LocalToolInstallationSucceeded
data.value: You can invoke the tool from this directory using the following commands: 'dotnet tool run {0}' or 'dotnet {0}'. Tool '{1}' (version '{2}') was successfully installed. Entry is added to the manifest file {3}.

data.name: GlobalOptionDescription
data.value: Install the tool for the current user.

data.name: LocalOptionDescription
data.value: Install the tool and add to the local tool manifest (default).

data.name: InstallFullCommandNameLocalized
data.value: .NET Install Command

data.name: InvalidToolConfiguration
data.value: The settings file in the tool's NuGet package is invalid: {0}

data.name: ToolInstallationFailed
data.value: Tool '{0}' failed to install.

data.name: ToolInstallationFailedWithRestoreGuidance
data.value:
Tool '{0}' failed to install. This failure may have been caused by:
* You are attempting to install a preview release and did not use the --version option to specify the version. * A package by this name was found, but it was not a .NET tool. * The required NuGet feed cannot be accessed, perhaps because of an Internet connection problem. * You mistyped the name of the tool.
For more reasons, including package naming enforcement, visit https://aka.ms/failure-installing-tool

data.name: ToolInstallationFailedContactAuthor
data.value: Tool '{0}' failed to install. Contact the tool author for assistance.

data.name: ToolInstallationRestoreFailed
data.value: The tool package could not be restored.

data.name: ToolAlreadyInstalled
data.value: Tool '{0}' is already installed.

data.name: FailedToCreateToolShim
data.value: Failed to create shell shim for tool '{0}': {1}

data.name: InvalidNuGetVersionRange
data.value: Specified version '{0}' is not a valid NuGet version range.

data.name: InstallToolCommandInvalidGlobalAndLocalAndToolPath
data.value: The local option(--local), the global option (--global), the tool path option (--tool-path), can only have one at a time. Specify only one of the options: {0}.

data.name: ToolPathOptionName
data.value: PATH

data.name: ToolPathOptionDescription
data.value: The directory where the tool will be installed. The directory will be created if it does not exist.

data.name: ManifestPathOptionDescription
data.value: Path to the manifest file.

data.name: ManifestPathOptionName
data.value: PATH

data.name: LocalOptionDoesNotSupportFrameworkOption
data.value: The local option(--local) does not support the framework option (--framework).

data.name: NoManifestGuide
data.value: If you intended to install a global tool, add `--global` to the command. If you would like to create a manifest, use `dotnet new tool-manifest`, usually in the repo root directory.

data.name: InvalidRuntimeIdentifier
data.value: The runtime identifier {0} is invalid. Valid runtime identifiers are: {1}.

data.name: PrereleaseAndVersionAreNotSupportedAtTheSameTime
data.value: The --prerelease and --version options are not supported in the same command

data.name: CreateManifestIfNeededOptionDescription
data.value: Create a tool manifest if one isn't found during tool installation. For information on how manifests are located, see https://aka.ms/dotnet/tools/create-manifest-if-needed
